summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Experian, demanding credit reports and related records for Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes the subpoena, a rider specifying the request, and a declaration from Experian's custodian of records certifying the production of documents.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena requests all credit reports, fraud alerts, and related documents pertaining to her, including accounts, addresses, and personal identifying information.

persons.name: Rick V. Haas
persons.context: He signed the declaration certifying that Experian produced records in response to the grand jury subpoena regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: A. Rey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena issued to Experian on June 29, 2020, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal criminal law.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, authorized the grand jury subpoena targeting Maxwell's financial records as part of a federal investigation.
Haas, as Experian's custodian of records, certified the production of Maxwell's credit reports and related financial documents in response to the subpoena.

events.title: Grand jury subpoena issued to Experian
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to Experian demanding credit reports and related documents for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled grand jury appearance for Experian
events.description: The subpoena commanded Experian's custodian of records to appear before the grand jury on this date to testify and produce documents, though personal appearance was waived if records were produced by the return date.

events.title: Declaration of custodian of records executed
events.description: Rick V. Haas signed a declaration certifying that Experian produced records in response to the grand jury subpoena regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, Room 480, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Experian on June 29, 2020, demanding all credit reports, fraud alerts, and related documents for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The investigation involved alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 371 (conspiracy), indicating a federal criminal conspiracy probe.
The subpoena included a non-disclosure request, asking Experian not to disclose the subpoena to any third party due to the ongoing nature of the investigation.
Experian's custodian of records, Rick V. Haas, certified the production of records on August 11, 2020, indicating compliance with the subpoena.
The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell's financial records as part of a grand jury proceeding in mid-2020.
